entry.title: Matrix
Perceptron from Scratch
entry.content:
Perceptron is the basic unit for neural network

$$\begin{aligned}f\left( x\right) =sign\left( w^{T}x\right) \\ sign\left( a\right) =\begin{cases}+1,a\geq 0\\ -1,a <0\end{cases}\end{aligned}$$

where $f(x)$ is the prediction and $x$ is the input matrix e.g. $[x,y]$ which is same as $[x_{1},x_{2}]$

Loss function:

$$\begin{align*}L &= \sum _{i\in Incorrections}-y_{i}\cdot \left( w^{T}\cdot x_{i}+b\right) \tag{1}\\L &= \sum ^{N}_{n=1}\max \left\{ -yi\cdot \left( w^{T}x_{i}+b\right) ,0\right\} \tag{2}\\L_{hinge} &= \sum ^{N}_{n=1} max(1-y{i}\cdot(w^Tx_{i}+b),0) \tag{3}\end{align*}$$

some people prefer combining weights and bias together s.t. weights = [w,b] and thus $\hat{y_{i}} = w^Tx_{i}$. For more explanation: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perceptron#Definitions

It’s easy to derive (2) from (1), moving on, we find the derivatives in (2) is the same as the derivatives in (3). That’s why some people say perceptron use hinge loss as cost function. But I would prefer (2) since the only difference is $+1$ and that’s just the way people manually define how strict the algorithm should be. We can use $+0$ in (2):

$$L = \sum ^{N}_{n=1}\max \left\{0 -yi\cdot \left( w^{T}x_{i}+b\right) ,0\right\} \tag{2}$$

For example: $y_{i} = 1, w^Tx_{i}+b=0.5$, for the data $x_{i}$, it is correctly classified since they are both positive meaning $x_{i}$ and $y_{i}$ are on the same side of the boundary. The loss is 0 in (2) and 0.5 in (3), meaning we are still not perfectly satisfied with the extent of separation with (3). Thus, we need to keep updating $w^T$ until $w^Tx_{i}+b = 1, L_{hinge} = 0$ which might be an extra cost for the algorithm.

Always keep in mind that perceptron is just a way to draw a boundary so that we can correctly classify different clusters. The reason I mention hinge loss is that hinge loss is commonly used in distance-related classification algorithms e.g. SVM.

Question:

why not use the total number of incorrect predictions as the loss function:

$$L = \sum ^{N}_{n=1} Indicator\left\{ y_{i}w^Tx_{i}<0 \right\}$$

The reason is that this loss function is basically 1-0 loss which is non-differentiable.

With appropriate loss function, we can optimize it using stochastic gradient descent.

We can break it down with steps:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perceptron

  1. pick one incorrect data point
  2. update weight/bias based on derivatives i.e. gradient of hinge loss
  3. repeat until all data points are correctly labeled

Resources:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perceptron

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hinge_loss

https://www.python-engineer.com/courses/mlfromscratch/06_perceptron/

https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1aE411o7qd?p=14

entry.title: K-Means from Scratch
entry.content:
K-means is an unsupervised clustering method with steps:

  1. randomly pick K data points as centroids
  2. for each data point, assign it to the closest centroid
  3. update each centroid with the mean of assigned data points
  4. repeat step 2,3 until new centroids and old centroids are merged

entry.title: Farewell to the Johns Hopkins University
entry.content:
I gained invaluable experience and knowledge at Hopkins. I’m always proud of being a blue jay and being grateful to our university.

During those two years, I’ve met a lot of great people including Dan, Remy, Eric, Stanley, Mark, Ciprian, etc. Feel free to let me know if you think I might have missed you :)

I wanted to express my special thanks to Dr. Brian Caffo. I learned not just knowledge but a lot of life lessons from him, from which I will definitely benefit for the rest of my life.

I’m sure we all incurred some challenges along this journey, and we should believe We have to be greater than what we suffer.

Hope it’s never too late to say thanks to everyone who helped me during my master’s and good-bye to JHU.

On – can congratulations on all graduates’ degree and enjoy the commencement – I’m confident you will find an opportunity that you will thrive in.

entry.title: Pitfalls of Data Normalization
entry.content:
解读：为什么要做特征归一化/标准化？

Why do we need normalization?

Normalization is not necessary for algorithms not related with distance

Correlation test

Pitfalls of Data Normalization

Naive Bayes

Tree-based algorithms: random forest / decision trees

Normalization is required for distance-related feature engineering

To explore conditional independency, we need to normalize data for estimation of inverse of covariance matrix – graphical lasso / PCA

PCA

KNN

K-means

SVM

entry.title: Git 101
entry.content:
The following image shows a great explanation of how git works

Lazily pull and push

If you are running on the windows system, just save the following code as git.sh file and run the *.sh file with Git for Windows.

It also works like a charm in RStudio

Manage subrepo without changing history

A lot of people already know how to add a subrepo using submodule and delete a submodule. But that’s how we manage “external” repos. (btw sometimes I just simply add the path of .git file under subrepo into the .gitignore file in the root folder)

In the case we want to move our own repo into another root repo as a subrepo without losing history. I’ve tried a lot of methods and so far the following method I found works well and pretty convenient.

Add the following code into your .bash_profile. In linux, edit .bashrc.

source your .bash_profile/.bashrc

and then

.gitignore

I usually do setting the gitignore file and syncing with github separately since I found git add . sometimes doesn’t work even though I have set up the .gitignore file correctly. To solve this, use git add $path to the specific files supposed to be ignored.

Check out the tutorial by atlassian for additional resources including ignoring syntax, ignoring a previously committed file, etc.

Branches

should show all the local branches of your repo. The starred branch is your current branch. If you just type git push, then the remote of the current branch is the default value.

In some projects like covid19_projections, people usually create a separate branch for the github page.

entry.title: Hexo 101
entry.content:
Tips and Tricks

This feature is just useless for me. Every time when I created a md file without title settings in the yaml, the website just can’t show the md file. (I just don’t wanna create a new post through the command like hexo new )

Change the file C:\Users\lcqi\Desktop\hexo ode_modules\hexo\lib\plugins\processor\post.js back to the previous version i.e. add the following commands in the file

https://blog.zhangruipeng.me/hexo-theme-icarus/Plugins/Analytics/icarus-user-guide-web-analytics-plugins/

为GitHub Pages自定义域名并添加SSL-开启https强制

Simply create CNAME file in your source file.

Don’t forget to make your website searchable:

https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/6065812

Porkbun Update

I choose to buy my domain on porkbun and I just found it’s pretty easy to connect domain to Github Pages

From domain to subdomain

In config file, change

to

updates:

for repo it’s better to use

https://github.com/LuchaoQi/blog.git instead of

https://github.com/LuchaoQi/blog

Add an RSS feed to your blog when people want to subscribe your website

google FeedBurner

https://blog.zhangruipeng.me/hexo-theme-icarus/Widgets/icarus-user-guide-widgets/#Subscribe-Email

http://www.codeblocq.com/2015/12/Add-an-RSS-feed-to-your-hexo-blog/

https://theinsider.idxcentral.com/tutorials/other-tutorials/how-to-set-up-a-feedburner-account/

Make custom homepage instead of recent posts

https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues/1077#issuecomment-381304203

Confirming that simply creating an index.md file in the my-site/source folder allows me to change the homepage.

I still wished to have a page which listed my most recent blog posts. So in my my-site/_config.yml I put

After creating the file (and running hexo g hexo s), when I access localhost:4000, I get my custom homepage. And then when I access localhost:4000/my-site/blog, I get the “original” homepage listing my blog posts.

I did not need to npm uninstall hexo-generator-index. I also did not need to create an html file, and did not need to do what @MoezGholami says above.

Also, put toc:false in your front-matter - You can set the default values for front-matter in _config.icarus.yml.

Display pdf file

  • Move Resume.pdf file toC:\Users\lcqi\Desktop\hexo\source
  • Change settings in config file C:\Users\lcqi\Desktop\hexo hemes\icarus\_config.yml

another solution

  • deploy git repo https://github.com/LuchaoQi/Resume
  • change the link to file https://luchaoqi.github.io/Resume/Resume/Resume.pdf
  • note https://luchaoqi.github.io/Resume/ will show 404 error

Easily create new post

put the following *.sh file in your root directory and double click the *.sh file using Git for Windows

Easily deploy and sync to github

double click the following *.sh file then all set!

Upload image

If you prefer setting up your own image hosting service, check out following links:

如何搭建一个自己图床网站

Chevereto-Free

Else checkout the following posts:

https://github.com/liolok/hexo-asset-link

https://liolok.github.io/en/How-to-Add-Image-to-Hexo-Blog-Post/

Insert Screenshot

One common scenario is to edit *.md posts in static sites (like Jekyll) using Typora. In Typora, set the following preference so the image files goes into our target file

In PicGo, you can upload your images to SM.MS. I would make a screenshot and then upload image with Ctrl Shift P. DONE! You can then paste the link already in your clipboard into your markdown file.

Use sm.ms

Typora now supports auto upload images

https://support.typora.io/Upload-Image/

On win10, it doesn’t work very well so you need to do some extra work

https://www.lzskyline.com/archives/87/

Config File:

Update:

I got the following error on a new PC

Error from the console:

Solution:

Choose Custom Command and install picgo through npm (set the config file as aforementioned)

then the Command should be

"C:\Users\lcqi\AppData\Roaming\npm\picgo" upload

You might be interested in marktext if you don’t want to waste time in configuration. OR you might try https://pasteboard.co/ since sometimes https://sm.ms/ doesn’t work - I have stopped using sm.ms service because I found most of my figures expired.

Load .js/.css files

How to load *.js files?

Put your javascript file in your js directory under your theme, for example,

luchaoqi.github.io hemes ext\source\js

load it in your _layout.swig file

luchaoqi.github.io hemes ext\layout

DONE!

404 error

Sometimes hexo works well locally but crashes when deploying. It may happens b/c javascript is case sensitive.

Local Search Error

https://qiuyiwu.github.io/2019/01/25/Hexo-LocalSearch/

Comment System

https://blog.zhangruipeng.me/hexo-theme-icarus/Plugins/Comment/icarus-user-guide-comment-plugins/

Themes

hexo-theme-icarus

Open Graph settings: Set og:image for social sharing doesn’t work for me. Instead, code below works well:

Two-column layout / License settings

Layout configuration files follow the same format and definitions as theme configuration files. The configurations in _config.post.yml apply to all posts, and those in _config.page.yml apply to all custom pages. They both override configurations in theme configuration files.

If you wish to override theme configurations only for a certain post/page, you can set them in the front-matter of that post/page. For example, you can change the code block highlight theme of a single post by setting it in that post’s front-matter like the following:

So settings in _config.post.yml apply to all the posts but not custom pages (index.md…)

Hexo Built-in Tag Helpers: Adding a caption to the code block

https://hexo.io/docs/tag-plugins.html

Hexo Next 7.7 双语切换
